title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: The Mass. RMV is offering a lottery for low-number MA250 commemorative license plates celebrating the state's 250th anniversary.
Residents can apply for free online through the RMV's Online Service Center from Feb. 16 to April 17, 2026.
1,000 plates are available, with winners announced in early May; standard registration and specialty plate fees apply.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts is the first state to deploy ChatGPT for nearly 40,000 executive branch employees, Governor Maura Healey announced.
The AI tool will be rolled out in phases, starting with the Executive Office of Technology Services and Security.
The National Association of Government Employees criticizes the AI roll-out, citing job security and adoption pace concerns.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles will close two Gardner facilities, affecting 91 jobs, by the end of September.
Astara Capital Partners acquired Garlock's flexible packaging operations in January 2021.
Garlock Flexibles, established in 1987, rebranded in 2023 to honor founder Pete Garlock.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, family says
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Robert Dorgan shot and killed ex-wife Rhonda and son Aidan during high school hockey game in Pawtucket.
Three others, including grandparents Linda and Jerry Dorgan, were critically injured in the shooting incident.
Robert Dorgan died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound; described by authorities as a family dispute.

title: Boston’s Vietnamese community celebrates Tết with culture and tradition
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The Tết festival, Boston's largest Vietnamese Lunar New Year event, was held at the Menino Convention & Exhibition Center.
Festival goers enjoyed traditional Vietnamese performances, cultural displays, and activities like calligraphy and Ao Dài dress sales.
The event promoted cultural connections among generations and welcomed diverse attendees, reflecting Boston's Vietnamese community spirit.

title: How a New Jersey runner is turning the 2026 Boston Marathon into a personal mission
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Kevin Brutus, from Guttenberg, NJ, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of his father, who died after a sixth stroke.
Brutus is participating with Tedy's Team to support heart disease and stroke research and awareness, aligning with his personal motivations.
This Boston Marathon marks Brutus's 10th marathon and fifth World Marathon Major, driven by his father's memory and his personal health awareness.

title: His future wife survived a medical emergency thanks to Boston MedFlight
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Sean Largay will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise funds for Boston MedFlight.
In 2024, Largay's future wife, Maggie Bea, survived a medical emergency with Boston MedFlight's assistance.
Largay aims to honor medical professionals through his marathon participation, emphasizing respect and gratitude.

title: He’s running the Boston Marathon to support young athletes
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ahmed Mansour will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to support the Boston Athletic Academy's youth programs.
The academy helps underprivileged youth access mentorship, education, and athletics, inspiring Mansour through his training.
Mansour aims to complete the World Marathon Majors, with Boston being his sixth out of seven races.

title: American Eagle Outfitters to close Devens distribution facility, cutting 103 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: American Eagle Outfitters will close its Devens distribution center, costing 103 jobs starting April 12.
The facility at 64 Jackson Road was previously part of Quiet Logistics, acquired by American Eagle for $360 million in 2021.
American Eagle is closing Quiet Logistics entirely to refocus on brand growth and improving its supply chain strategy.

title: Mass. lowers flags to half-staff in honor of fallen soldier Robert Arnold
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Flags in Massachusetts were lowered to half-staff in honor of U.S. Army Staff Sgt. Robert R. Arnold who died at 27.
Arnold, a Roslindale native and Boston Latin School graduate, served in the U.S. Army and previously in the Marine Corps.
State Rep. Steve Xiarhos expressed condolences and highlighted Arnold's dedication and service in a Facebook post.
